flow.label: Chat Data AWEL flow template(text2SQL)
flow.name: chat_data_awel_flow_template
flow.description: An example of a Chat Data with AWEL flow.

data.label: Common LLM Http Trigger
data.name: common_llm_http_trigger
data.description: Trigger your workflow by http request, and parse the request body as a common LLM http body

outputs.label: Request Body
outputs.name: request_body
outputs.description: The request body of the API endpoint, parse as a common LLM http body

outputs.label: Request String Messages
outputs.name: request_string_messages
outputs.description: The request string messages of the API endpoint, parsed from 'messages' field of the request body

parameters.label: API Endpoint
parameters.name: endpoint
parameters.description: The API endpoint

parameters.label: Http Methods
parameters.name: methods
parameters.description: The methods of the API endpoint

parameters.label: Streaming Response
parameters.name: streaming_response
parameters.description: Whether the response is streaming

parameters.label: Http Response Body
parameters.name: http_response_body
parameters.description: The response body of the API endpoint

parameters.label: Response Media Type
parameters.name: response_media_type
parameters.description: The response media type

parameters.label: Http Status Code
parameters.name: status_code
parameters.description: The http status code

data.label: Common Chat Prompt Template
data.name: common_chat_prompt_template
data.description: The operator to build the prompt with static prompt.

parameters.label: System Message
parameters.name: system_message
parameters.default: You are a helpful AI Assistant.
parameters.description: The system message.
parameters.value:
{context}

when answering, use the same language as the "user".

parameters.label: Message placeholder
parameters.name: message_placeholder
parameters.description: The chat history message placeholder.

parameters.label: Human Message
parameters.name: human_message
parameters.description: The human message.

data.label: Datasource Retriever Operator
data.name: higher_order_datasource_retriever_operator
data.description: Retrieve the table schemas from the datasource.

inputs.label: User question
inputs.name: query
inputs.description: The user question to retrieve table schemas from the datasource

outputs.label: Retrieved context
outputs.name: context
outputs.description: The retrieved context from the datasource

outputs.label: Retrieved schema chunks
outputs.name: chunks
outputs.description: The retrieved schema chunks from the datasource

parameters.label: Datasource
parameters.name: datasource
parameters.description: The datasource to retrieve the context

parameters.label: Prompt Template
parameters.name: prompt_template
parameters.default:
You are a database expert. 
Please answer the user's question based on the database selected by the user and some of the available table structure definitions of the database.
Database name:
     {db_name}
Table structure definition:
     {table_info}

Constraint:
    1.Please understand the user's intention based on the user's question, and use the     given table structure definition to create a grammatically correct {dialect} sql.     If sql is not required, answer the user's question directly.. 
    2.Always limit the query to a maximum of {max_num_results} results unless the user     specifies in the question the specific number of rows of data he wishes to obtain.
    3.You can only use the tables provided in the table structure information to     generate sql. If you cannot generate sql based on the provided table structure,     please say: "The table structure information provided is not enough to generate     sql queries." It is prohibited to fabricate information at will.
    4.Please be careful not to mistake the relationship between tables and columns     when generating SQL.
    5.Please check the correctness of the SQL and ensure that the query performance is     optimized under correct conditions.
    6.Please choose the best one from the display methods given below for data     rendering, and put the type name into the name parameter value that returns the     required format. If you cannot find the most suitable one, use 'Table' as the     display method. , the available data display methods are as follows: {display_type}

User Question:
    {user_input}
Please think step by step and respond according to the following JSON format:
    {response}
Ensure the response is correct json and can be parsed by Python json.loads.
parameters.description: The prompt template to build a database prompt

parameters.label: Display Type
parameters.name: display_type
parameters.default:
response_line_chart:used to display comparative trend analysis data
response_pie_chart:suitable for scenarios such as proportion and distribution statistics
response_table:suitable for display with many display columns or non-numeric columns
response_scatter_chart:Suitable for exploring relationships between variables, detecting outliers, etc.
response_bubble_chart:Suitable for relationships between multiple variables, highlighting outliers or special situations, etc.
response_donut_chart:Suitable for hierarchical structure representation, category proportion display and highlighting key categories, etc.
response_area_chart:Suitable for visualization of time series data, comparison of multiple groups of data, analysis of data change trends, etc.
response_heatmap:Suitable for visual analysis of time series data, large-scale data sets, distribution of classified data, etc.
parameters.description: The display type for the data

parameters.label: Max Number of Results
parameters.name: max_num_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return

parameters.label: Response Format
parameters.name: response_format
parameters.description: The response format, default is a JSON format

parameters.label: Context Key
parameters.name: context_key
parameters.description: The key of the context, it will be used in building the prompt

data.label: LLM Operator
data.name: higher_order_llm_operator
data.description: High-level LLM operator, supports multi-round conversation (conversation window, token length and no multi-round).

inputs.label: Extra Context
inputs.name: extra_context
inputs.description: Extra context for building prompt(Knowledge context, database schema, etc), you can add multiple context.

parameters.label: Prompt Template
parameters.name: prompt_template
parameters.description: The prompt template for the conversation.

parameters.label: Model Name
parameters.name: model
parameters.description: The model name.

parameters.label: LLM Client
parameters.name: llm_client
parameters.description: The LLM Client, how to connect to the LLM model, if not provided, it will use the default client deployed by DB-GPT.

parameters.label: History Message Merge Mode
parameters.name: history_merge_mode
parameters.description: The history merge mode, supports 'none', 'window' and 'token'. 'none': no history merge, 'window': merge by conversation window, 'token': merge by token length.

parameters.label: User Message Key
parameters.name: user_message_key
parameters.description: The key of the user message in your prompt, default is 'user_input'.

parameters.label: History Key
parameters.name: history_key
parameters.description: The chat history key, with chat history message pass to prompt template, if not provided, it will parse the prompt template to get the key.

parameters.label: Keep Start Rounds
parameters.name: keep_start_rounds
parameters.description: The start rounds to keep in the chat history.

parameters.label: Keep End Rounds
parameters.name: keep_end_rounds
parameters.description: The end rounds to keep in the chat history.

parameters.label: Max Token Limit
parameters.name: max_token_limit
parameters.description: The max token limit to keep in the chat history.

data.label: SQL Output Parser
data.name: default_sql_output_parser
data.description: Parse the SQL output of an LLM call.

data.label: Datasource Resource
data.name: datasource
data.description: Connect to a datasource(retrieve table schemas and execute SQL to fetch data).

parameters.label: Datasource Name
parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the datasource, default is 'datasource'.

parameters.label: DB Name
parameters.name: db_name
parameters.description: The name of the database.

parameters.label: Prompt Template
parameters.name: prompt_template
parameters.default: Database type: {db_type}, related table structure definition: {schemas}
parameters.description: The prompt template to build a database prompt.

data.label: Datasource Executor Operator
data.name: higher_order_datasource_executor_operator
data.description: Execute the context from the datasource.

inputs.label: SQL dict
inputs.name: sql_dict
inputs.description: The SQL to be executed wrapped in a dictionary, generated by LLM

outputs.label: SQL result
outputs.name: sql_result
outputs.description: The result of the SQL execution(GPT-Vis format)

outputs.label: Markdown result
outputs.name: markdown_result
outputs.description: The markdown result of the SQL execution

parameters.label: Datasource
parameters.name: datasource
parameters.description: The datasource to retrieve the context

inputs.label: The data report
inputs.name: data_report
inputs.description: The data report in markdown format.

parameters.label: Prompt Template
parameters.name: prompt_template
parameters.description: The prompt template for the conversation.

parameters.label: Model Name
parameters.name: model
parameters.description: The model name.

parameters.label: LLM Client
parameters.name: llm_client
parameters.description: The LLM Client, how to connect to the LLM model, if not provided, it will use the default client deployed by DB-GPT.

data.label: String Join Operator
data.name: string_join_operator
data.description: Merge multiple inputs into a single string.

parameters.label: Separator
parameters.name: separator
parameters.description: The separator to join the strings.
